scope.gco:CharacterString: Codelists for description of metadata datasets compliant with ISO/TC 211 19115:2003 and 19139

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: identification of when a given event occurred

CodeDefinition.gml:description: date identifies when the resource was brought into existence
date identifies when the resource was issued
date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended
date identifies when resource expires
date identifies when resource was last updated
date identifies when resource was last reviewed
date identifies when resource will be next updated
date identifies when resource became not available or obtainable
date identifies when resource became in force
date identifies when resource was adopted
date identifies when resource was deprecated
date identifies when resource was superseded or replaced by another resource
time at which the data are considered to become valid. NOTE: There could be quite a delay between creation and validity begins
time at which the data are no longer considered to be valid
the date that the resource shall be released for public access
date identifies when an instance of the resource was distributed

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: function performed by the resource

CodeDefinition.gml:description: online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another
online information about the resource
online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider
online order process for obtening the resource
online search interface for seeking out information about the resource
complete metadata provided
browse graphic provided
online resource upload capability provided
online email service provided
online browsing provided
online file access provided

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: mode in which the data is represented

CodeDefinition.gml:description: digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)
representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photograhic material, or other media

likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user
map represented in raster or vector form
map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user
multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.
3-dimensional, physical model
vertical cross-section in digital form
vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.
digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns
representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media
digital video recording
video recording on film
digital audio recording
audio recording delivered by analog media, such as a magnetic tape
information representation using simultaneously various digital modes for text, sound, image
information representation using simultaneously various analog modes for text, sound, image
a physical object, e.g. Rock or mineral sample, microscope slide
information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart, and other type of diagrams and recorded in digital format
information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart, and other type of diagrams and printed on paper, phototographic material, or other media

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: function performed by the responsible party

CodeDefinition.gml:description: party that supplies the resource
party that accepts accountability and responsability for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource
party that owns the resource
party that sponsors the resource
party who uses the resource
party who distributes the resource
party who created the resource
party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource
key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research
party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified
party who published the resource
party who authored the resource
party who jointly authors the resource
party who assists with the generation of the resource other than the principal investigator
party who reviewed or modified the resource to improve the content
a class of entity that mediates access to the resource and for whom the resource is intended or useful
party owning or managing rights over the resource
party contributing to the resource
party providing monetary support for the resource
party who has an interest in the resource or the use of the resource

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: type or method for evaluating an identified data quality measure

CodeDefinition.gml:description: method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated
method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required
method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: justification for the correlation of two datasets

CodeDefinition.gml:description: reference from one dataset to another
reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part
part of the same structured set of data held in a computer
mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates
part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images
reference to resources that are parts of this resource
common title for a collection of resources. NOTE: title identifies elements of a series collectively, combined with information about what volumes are available at the source cite
associated through a common heritage such as produced to a common product specification
associated through a dependency
resource is a revision of associated resource

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: type of aggregation activity in which datasets are related

CodeDefinition.gml:description: series of organized planned actions
accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose
element and entity definitions
specific performance of a function or group of functions
process designed to find if something is effective or valid
search or systematic inquiry
specific operation of a data collection system
device or piece of equipment which detects or records
action that is part of a series of actions
vehicle or other support base that holds a sensor
method of doing something involving a number of steps
specific planned activity
organized undertaking, research, or development
document based on an experiment or research
examination or investigation
piece of work
process of testing to discover or demonstrate something
operating manual for users

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: code indicating whether grid data is point or area

CodeDefinition.gml:description: each cell represents a point
each cell represents an area
each cell represents a volumetric measurement on a regular grid in three dimensional space
height range for a single point vertical profile

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: name of the character coding standard used in the resource

CodeDefinition.gml:description: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646
32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646
7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646
ISO/IEC 8859-1, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 1 : Latin alphabet No.1
ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 2 : Latin alphabet No.2
ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 3 : Latin alphabet No.3
ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 4 : Latin alphabet No.4
ISO/IEC 8859-5, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 5 : Latin/Cyrillic alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 6 : Latin/Arabic alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 7 : Latin/Greek alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 8 : Latin/Hebrew alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-9, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 9 : Latin alphabet No.5
ISO/IEC 8859-10, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 10 : Latin alphabet No.6
ISO/IEC 8859-11, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 11 : Latin/Thai alphabet
ISO/IEC 8859-13, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 13 : Latin alphabet No.7
ISO/IEC 8859-14, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 14 : Latin alphabet No.8 (Celtic)
ISO/IEC 8859-15, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 15 : Latin alphabet No.9
ISO/IEC 8859-16, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 16 : Latin alphabet No.10
japanese code set used for electronic transmission
japanese code set used on MS-DOS machines
japanese code set used on UNIX based machines
United States ASCII code set (ISO 646 US)
IBM mainframe code set
Korean code set
traditional Chinese code set used in Taiwan, Hong Kong of China and other areas
simplified Chinese code set

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: name of the handling restrictions on the dataset

CodeDefinition.gml:description: available for general disclosure
not for general disclosure
available for someone who can be entrusted with information
kept or meant to be kept private, unknown, or hidden from all but a select group of people
of the highest secrecy
although unclassified, requires strict controls over its distribution
unclassified information that is to be used only for official purposes determined by the designating body
compromise of the information could cause damage
desimination limited by designating body

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: specific type of information represented in the cell

CodeDefinition.gml:description: meaningful numerical representation of a physical parameter that is not the actual value of the physical parameter
code value with no quantitative meaning, used to represent a physical quantity
value in physical units of the quantity being measured

data, usually a physical measurement, used to support the calculation of the primary physicalMeasurement coverages in the dataset (e.g. grid of aerosol optical thickness used in the calculation of a sea surface temperature product).
data used to characterize the quality of the physicalMeasurement coverages in the dataset. Typically included in a gmi:QE_CoverageResult.
reference information used to support the calculation or use of the physicalMeasurement coverages in the dataset (e.g. grids of latitude/longitude used to geolocate the physical measurements).
resources with values that are calculated using a model rather than being observed or calculated from observations.
data used to provide coordinate axis values
values of extraneous data that are not part of the physical measurement

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: datatype of element or entity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior
descriptor of a set of objects that share the same attributes, operations, methods, relationships, and behavior
data type whose instances form a list of named literal values, not extendable
permissible value for a codelist or enumeration
class that cannot be directly instantiated
class that is composed of classes it is connected to by an aggregate relationship
subclass that may be substituted for its superclass
class with few or no operations whose primary purpose is to hold the abstract state of another class for transmittal, storage, encoding or persistent storage
named set of operations that characterize the behavior of an element
class describing a selection of one of the specified types
class whose instances are classes
class used for specification of a domain of instances (objects), together with the operations applicable to the objects. A type may have attributes and associations
free text field
numerical field
semantic relationship between two classes that involves connections among their instances

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: name of the dimension

CodeDefinition.gml:description: ordinate (y) axis
abscissa (x) axis
vertical (z) axis
along the direction of motion of the scan point
perpendicular to the direction of motion of the scan point
scan line of a sensor
element along a scan line
duration

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: name of point or vector objects used to locate zero-, one-, two-, or three-dimensional spatial locations in the dataset

CodeDefinition.gml:description: set of geometric primitives such that their boundaries can be represented as a union of other primitives
connected set of curves, solids or surfaces
bounded, 1-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a line
zero-dimensional geometric primitive, representing a position but not having an extent
bounded, connected 3-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of space
bounded, connected 2-dimensional geometric primitive, representing the continuous image of a region of a plane

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: code which indicates conditions which may affect the image

CodeDefinition.gml:description: portion of the image is blurred
portion of the image is partially obscured by cloud cover
acute angle between the plane of the ecliptic (the plane of the Earth s orbit) and the plane of the celestial equator
portion of the image is partially obscured by fog
portion of the image is partially obscured by heavy smoke or dust
image was taken at night
image was taken during rainfall
image was taken during semi-dark conditions -- twilight conditions
portion of the image is obscured by shadow
portion of the image is obscured by snow

the absence of collection data of a given point or area caused by the relative location of topographic features which obstruct the collection path between the collector(s) and the subject(s) of interest

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: methods used to group similar keywords

CodeDefinition.gml:description: keyword identifies a data centre related to the resource
keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning
keyword identifies a location
keyword identifies a temporal or spatial resolution
keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance
keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset
keyword identifies a particular subject or topic
keyword identifies a repository or archive that manages and distributes data
keyword identifies a resource containing or about a collection of feature instances with common characteristics
keyword identifies a device used to measure or compare physical properties
keyword identifies a structure upon which an instrument is mounted
keyword identifies a series of actions or natural occurrences
keyword identifies an endeavour undertaken to create or modify a product or service
keyword identifies an activity carried out by one party for the benefit of another
keyword identifies a type of product
refinement of a topic category for the purpose of geographic data classification

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: frequency with which modifications and deletions are made to the data after it is first produced

CodeDefinition.gml:description: data is repeatedly and frequently updated
data is updated each day
data is updated on a weekly basis
data is updated every two weeks
data is updated each month
data is updated every three months
data is updated twice each year
data is updated every year
data is updated as deemed necessary
data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration
there are no plans to update the data
frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: method used to write to the medium

CodeDefinition.gml:description: CoPy In / Out (UNIX file format and command)
Tape ARchive
high sierra file system
information processing volume and file structure of CD-ROM
rock ridge interchange protocol (UNIX)
hierarchical file system (Macintosh)
universal disk format

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: name of the medium

CodeDefinition.gml:description: read-only optical disk
digital versatile disk
digital versatile disk, read only
3,5 inch magnetic disk
5,25 inch magnetic disk
7 track magnetic tape
9 track magnetic tape
3480 cartridge tape drive
3490 cartridge tape drive
3580 cartridge tape drive
4 millimetre magnetic tape
8 millimetre magnetic tape
0,25 inch magnetic tape
half inch cartridge streaming tape drive
direct computer linkage
linkage through a satellite communication system
communication through a telephone network
pamphlet or leaflet giving descriptive information

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: obligation of the element or entity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: element is always required
element is not required
element is required when a specific condition is met

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel

CodeDefinition.gml:description: point halfway between the lower left and the upper right of the pixel
the corner in the pixel closest to the origin of the SRS; if two are at the same distance from the origin, the one with the smallest x-value
next corner counterclockwise from the lower left
next corner counterclockwise from the lower right
next corner counterclockwise from the upper right

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: status of the dataset or progress of a review

CodeDefinition.gml:description: production of the data has been completed
data has been stored in an offline storage facility
data is no longer relevant
data is continually being updated
fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated
data needs to be generated or updated
data is currently in the process of being created
progress concluded and no changes will be accepted
committed to, but not yet addressed
item is no longer recommended for use. It has not been superseded by another item
replaced by new
provisional changes likely before resource becomes final or complete
acceptable under specific conditions
agreed to by sponsor
rejected by sponsor
removed from consideration
suggested that development needs to be undertaken
resource superseded and will become obsolete, use only for historical purposes

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: limitation(s) placed upon the access or use of the data

CodeDefinition.gml:description: exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor
government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery
produced or sold information awaiting a patent
a name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer
formal permission to do something
rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity
withheld from general circulation or disclosure
limitation not listed
no constraints exist
formal permission not required to use the resource
formal permission required for a person or an entity to use the resource and that may differ from the person that orders or purchases it
formal permission required for a person or an entity to commercialize or distribute the resource
protects rights of individual or organisations from observation, intrusion, or attention of others
prescribed by law
not available to the public contains information that could be prejudicial to a commercial, industrial, or national interest
although unclassified, requires strict controls over its distribution.
with trust

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: class of information to which the referencing entity applies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: information applies to the attribute class
information applies to the characteristic of a feature
information applies to the collection hardware class
information applies to the collection session
information applies to the dataset
information applies to the series
information applies to non-geographic data
information applies to a dimension group
information applies to a feature
information applies to a feature type
information applies to a property type
information applies to a field session
information applies to a computer program or routine
information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case
information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object
information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data
information applies to metadata
information applies to an initiative
information applies to a sample
information applies to a document
information applies to a repository
information applies to an aggregate resource
metadata describing an ISO 19131 data product specification
information applies to an unstructured set
information applies to a coverage
information resource hosted on a specific set of hardware and accessible over a network

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: method used to represent geographic information in the dataset

CodeDefinition.gml:description: vector data is used to represent geographic data
grid data is used to represent geographic data
textual or tabular data is used to represent geographic data
triangulated irregular network
three-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images
scene from a video recording

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: high-level geographic data thematic classification to assist in the grouping and search of available geographic data sets. Can be used to group keywords as well. Listed examples are not exhaustive.

CodeDefinition.gml:description: rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock
flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat
legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries
processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas
height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth s rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion
health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services
base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations
military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection
inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts
positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names
features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs
information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information
man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers
means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks
region more than 100 km above the surface of the Earth
Information related to disasters. Examples: site of the disaster, evacuation zone, disaster-prevention facility, disaster relief activities

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: degree of complexity of the spatial relationships

CodeDefinition.gml:description: geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology
1-dimensional topological complex -- commonly called chain-node topology
1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)
2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called full topology in a cartographic 2D environment.)

1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundry-preserving correspondence to one another.)
2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface
3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)
complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space
topological complex without any specified geometric realisation

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: designation of criterion for defining maximum and minimum wavelengths for a spectral band

CodeDefinition.gml:description: width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level half of that at the peak
width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level half of that at the peak
full spectral width of a spectral power density measured at 50% of its peak height
width of a distribution equal to the distance between the outer two points on the distribution having power level 1/e that of the peak
width of a band with full sensitivity or absorption at every wavelength that detects or absorbs the same amount of energy as the band described

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: designation of criterion for defining the context of the scanning process event

CodeDefinition.gml:description: event related to a specific domain
event related to a sequence of collections
event related to navigational manoeuvre

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: geometric description of the collection

CodeDefinition.gml:description: single geographic point of interest
extended collection in a single vector
collection of a geographic area defined by a polygon (coverage)
series of linear collections grouped by way points

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: temporal persistence of collection objective

CodeDefinition.gml:description: single instance of collection
multiple instances of collection
collection over specified domain

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: code indicating whether the data contained in this packet is real, simulated, or synthesized

CodeDefinition.gml:description: originates from live-fly or other non-simulated operational source
originates from target simulator sources
mix of real and simulated data

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: Polarisation of the antenna relative to the waveform

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the horizontal plane in realtion to the swath direction
Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the vertical plane in realtion to the swath direction
Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the left circular plane in realtion to the swath direction
Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the right circular plane in realtion to the swath direction
Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the angle between +90 deg and 0 deg parallel to swath direction
Polarisation of the sensor oriented in the angle between +90 deg and 0 deg perpendicular to swath direction

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: ordered list of priorities

CodeDefinition.gml:description: decisive importance
requires resources to be made available
normal operation priority
to be completed when resources are available

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: temporal relation of activation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: beginning of a collection
end of a collection
collection without a significant duration

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: transform function to be used when scaling a physical value for a given element

CodeDefinition.gml:description: beginning of a collection
end of a collection
collection without a significant duration

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: mechanism of activation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: event due to external stimuli
event manually instigated
event instigated by planned internal stimuli

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: Extension of MD_ScopeCode for the needs of GMX application schemas and in the context of a transfer

CodeDefinition.gml:description: information applies to the attribute class
information applies to the characteristic of a feature
information applies to the collection hardware class
information applies to the collection session
information applies to the dataset
information applies to the series
information applies to non-geographic data
information applies to a dimension group
information applies to a feature
information applies to a feature type
information applies to a property type
information applies to a field session
information applies to a computer program or routine
information applies to a capability which a service provider entity makes available to a service user entity through a set of interfaces that define a behaviour, such as a use case
information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object
information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as an initiative (DS_Initiative)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a stereo mate (DS_StereoMate)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor (DS_Sensor)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a platform series (DS_PlatformSeries)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a sensor series (DS_SensorSeries)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which was originally identified as a production series (DS_ProductionSeries)
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has no existence outside of the transfer context
The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has an existence outside of the transfer context, but which does not pertains to a specific aggregate type.

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: indication of service instance coupling

CodeDefinition.gml:description: service instance is loosely coupled with a data instance, i.e. no MD_DataIdentification class has to be described

service instance is mixed coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification describes the associated data instance and additionally the service instance might work with other external data instances
service instance is tightly coupled with a data instance, i.e. MD_DataIdentification class MUST be described

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: indication if the parameter is an input to the service, an output or both

CodeDefinition.gml:description: indication if the parameter is an input to the service, an output or both
the parameter is an output parameter to the service instance
the parameter is both an input and output parameter to the service instance

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: distributed computing platforms on which the operation has been implemented

CodeDefinition.gml:description: component object model - Microsoft's framework for developing and supporting program component objects
common object request broker architecture
JAVA programming language
structured query language - a standard interactive and programming language for getting information from and updating a database
Web based services
extensible markup language

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: code list for the classification of roles

CodeDefinition.gml:description: indicates an ordinary association
indicates a UML aggregation (part role)
indicates a UML composition (member role)
